modName: Creating A New Dummy Object With NifSkope
summary: This simple tutorial will help you to create new dummy objects, without using complicated programs for 3D modeling.
descriptionHtml:
1. Extract an NIF file from the BSA archive (in this tutorial used [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/36901/]Fallout Mod Manager[/url], it's compatible with Skyrim).

[img]http://static2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/50090-1-1390282046.png[/img]




2. Open extracted NIF file with [url=http://niftools.sourceforge.net/wiki/NifSkope]NifSkope[/url], and remove any branches, except "BSXFlags" and "NiTriShape" (or NiNode) in the main tree. Expand each "NiTriShape" branch and remove any blocks, except "NiTriShapeData".

[img]http://static1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/50090-1-1390266470.gif[/img]




3. Now we need to copy "BSEffectShaderProperty" and "NiAlphaProperty" blocks from the any Vanilla dummy to our NIF (this data the same for all dummy meshes, so no matter what of them you choose).
Extract any Vanilla dummy NIF, open in the new window and copy "BSEffectShaderProperty" and "NiAlphaProperty" blocks to the each "NiTriShape" branch in our dummy, follow the same block order.

[img]http://static1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/50090-2-1390266470.gif[/img]




4. Select "NiTriShapeData" block and make sure that entry "Has Vertex Colors" set to "yes". Open "Vertex Colors" and this is the most tedious part (yes, that's what you think, take a deep breath, grab some coffee and keep working).

[img]http://static1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/50090-3-1390266471.gif[/img]

In Vanilla for dummy objects used four colors:

[color=Royalblue]0.000 0.000 1.000 0.500 Blue[/color]
[color=Forestgreen]0.000 0.400 0.000 0.500 Green[/color]
[color=Orange]1.000 0.400 0.000 0.500 Orange[/color]
[color=Firebrick]1.000 0.400 0.000 0.500 Red[/color]

but you free to use any colors that you prefer.




5. Rename branches in Bethesda style

[img]http://static1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/50090-4-1390266471.gif[/img]




6. Save your NIF file to "Skyrim/Data/Meshes" (default pach for dummies is "Meshes/Clutter/DummyItems").

Sometimes in Creation Kit when you drop the object with new mesh, created in current session, to the render window you may see the error marker. It's an Creation Kit bug, save and reload your plugin, it will not appear again for this object.




Credit: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/848320/]@XunAmarox[/url]

Used Applications: [url=http://www.blumentals.net/egifan/]Easy GIF Animator[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/36901/]Fallout Mod Manager[/url], [url=http://www.gimp.org/]GIMP[/url], [url=http://lightscreen.sourceforge.net/]Lightscreen[/url], [url=http://niftools.sourceforge.net/wiki/NifSkope]NifSkope[/url]
